title: Azimuth
summary: An azimuth (/ˈæzəməθ/ (listen); from Arabic: اَلسُّمُوت‎, romanized: as-sumūt, lit. 'the directions')[1] is an angular measurement in a spherical coordinate system. The vector from an observer (origin) to a point of interest is projected perpendicularly onto a reference plane; the angle between the projected vector and a reference vector on the reference plane is called the azimuth.
